choices.C: Install SAP ECC EHP 8 on Amazon EC2 instances. Use the same SAP SID and kernel version that the source system uses. Install SAP HANA on EC2 instances. Use the same version that the source system uses. Take a full offline backup of the source SAP HANA database. Copy the backup to Amazon S3 by using the AWS CLI. Restore the backup on a target SAP HANA instance that runs on Amazon EC2. Start SAP on the EC2 instances.
choices.A: Install SAP ECC EHP 8 on Amazon EC2 instances. Use the same SAP SID and kernel version that the source system uses. Install SAP HANA on EC2 instances. Use the same version of SAP HANA that the source system uses. Take a full backup of the source SAP HANA database to disk. Copy the backup by using an AWS Storage Gateway Tape Gateway. Restore the backup on the target SAP HANA instance that is running on Amazon EC2.
choices.B: Install SAP ECC EHP 8 on Amazon EC2 instances. Use the same SAP SID and kernel version that the source system uses. Install SAP HANA on EC2 instances. Use the same version of SAP HANA that the source database uses. Establish replication at the source, and register the SAP HANA instance that is running on Amazon EC2 as secondary. After the systems are synchronized, initiate a takeover so that the SAP HANA instance that is running on Amazon EC2 becomes primary. Shut down the on-premises system. Start SAP on the EC2 instances.
choices.D: Take an offline SAP Software Provisioning Manager export of the on-premises system. Use an AWS Storage Gateway File Gateway to transfer the export. Import the export on Amazon EC2 instances to create the target SAP system.

questions.question_text:
A company is evaluating options to migrate its on-premises SAP ERP Central Component (SAP ECC) EHP 8 system to AWS. The company does not want to make any changes to the SAP versions or database versions. The system runs on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server and SAP HANA 2.0 SPS 05. The existing on-premises system has a 1 TB database.

The company has 1 Gbps or internet bandwidth available for the migration. The company must complete the migration with the least possible downtime and disruption to business.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B: This option is leveraging system replication between the systems, allowing the migration to be completed with minimal downtime. Additionally, replication of the SAP HANA database is highly efficient, minimizing disruption to the business.

Selected Answer: B
B as it talks about preventing Downtime

questions.question_text:
A company is running its SAP system on AWS with a secondary SAP HANA database in a sidecar setup. The company requires high IOPS for write performance on its Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes for the secondary SAP HANA database.

The EBS volume that the company uses for its SAP HANA data volume cannot provide the required IOPS. Instance bandwidth for the Amazon EC2 instance that is hosting the SAP HANA database is sufficient. An SAP solutions architect needs to propose a solution to resolve the IOPS performance issue.

Which solution will achieve the required IOPS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Only possible option I see is using striping.

choices.B: Create a RAID 0 configuration with several EBS volumes.
choices.D: Create a placement group with several EBS volumes.
choices.C: Use Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling to launch Spot Instances.
choices.A: Replace the EBS storage with EC2 instance store storage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D:

Selected Answer: AD
I think A D

questions.question_text:
An SAP solutions architect is designing an SAP HANA scale-out architecture for SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) on SAP HANA on AWS. The SAP solutions architect identifies the design as a three-node scale-out deployment of xte.32xiarge Amazon EC2 instances.
The SAP solutions architect must ensure that the SAP HANA scale-out nodes can achieve the low-latency and high-throughput network performance that are necessary for node-to-node communication.
Which combination of steps should the SAP solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Switch to a different instance family that provides network throughput that is greater than 25 Gbps.
choices.A: Create a cluster placement group. Launch the instances into the cluster placement group.
choices.B: Create a spread placement group. Launch the instances into the spread placement group.
choices.D: Based on the operating system version, verify that enhanced networking is enabled on all the nodes.
choices.C: Create a partition placement group. Launch the instances into the partition placement group.
Launch the instance that the SAProuter software will be installed on into a public subnet of the VPAssign the instance an overlay IP address.
choices.E: Create a specific security group for the SAProuter instance. Configure rules to allow the required inbound and outbound access to the SAP support network. Include a rule that denies inbound traffic to TCP port 3299.
choices.B: Launch the instance that the SAProuter software will be installed on into a public subnet of the VPC. Assign the VPC an Elastic IP address.
choices.A: Launch the instance that the SAProuter software will be installed on into a private subnet of the VPC. Assign the instance an Elastic IP address.
choices.D: Create a specific security group for the SAProuter instance. Configure rules to allow the required inbound and outbound access to the SAP support network. Include a rule that allows inbound traffic to TCP port 3299.
choices.F: Use a Secure Network Communication (SNC) internet connection.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDF
BDF as documented in the links provided by LocalHero and banbu556

Selected Answer: BDF
SNC for secure communication.

Selected Answer: BDF
For the SAProuter instance, create and configure a specific SAProuter security group, which only allows the required inbound and outbound access to the SAP support network. This should be limited to a specific IP address that SAP gives you to connect to, along with TCP port 3299. Launch the instance that the SAProuter software will be installed on into a public subnet of the VPC and assign it an Elastic IP address. Secure Network Communication (SNC
How can D&E be right answers when both are contradictory?

Selected Answer: ADF
In my opinion ADF

questions.question_text:
A company is preparing a greenfield deployment of SAP S/4HANA on AWS. The company wants to ensure that this new SAP S/4HANA landscape is fully supported by SAP. The company's SAP solutions architect needs to set up a new SAProuter connection directly to SAP from the company's landscape within the VPC.

Which combination of steps must the SAP solutions architect take to accomplish this goal? (Choose three.)

A company is running its on-premises SAP ERP Central Component (SAP ECC) production system on an Oracle database. The company needs to migrate the system to AWS and change the database to SAP HANA on AWS.

The system must be highly available. The company also needs a failover system to be available in a different AWS Region to support disaster recovery (DR). The DR solution must meet an RTO of 4 hours and an RPO of 30 minutes. The sizing estimate for the SAP HANA database on AWS is 4 TB.

Which combination of steps should the company take to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Deploy the production system across two Availability Zones in the primary Region. Deploy the DR system in a single Availability Zone in another Region.
choices.B: Deploy the production system across two Availability Zones in one Region. Deploy the DR system in a third Availability Zone in the same Region.
choices.E: Set up Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) to store the shared file system data. Configure AWS Backup for DR.
choices.D: Create an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system in the primary Region for the SAP global file system. Deploy a second EFS file system in the DR Region. Configure EFS replication between the file systems.
choices.A: Deploy the production system and the DR system in two Availability Zones in the same Region.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Would be C and D.
C makes the most sense when regarding the HA, E is not as suitable for shared files system as it uses EBS.
Shared file systems should be using EFS.
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/awsforsap/simplify-sap-backups-with-aws-services/

Would be C and D. 
C makes the most sense when regarding the HA, E is not as suitable for shared files system as it uses EBS. 
Shared file systems should be using EFS.
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/awsforsap/simplify-sap-backups-with-aws-services/

exam.name: AWS Certified SAP on AWS - Specialty PAS-C01
